commit 5acec4538e9da541d04de3a4dc06a4797b9b1746
Author: matkov <boris.matkov@gmail.com>
Date:   2021-03-05 12:45:46 +0200

    Support for Batch operations in UniDAC
    
    1. Support for batch operations in the UniDAC is added
    2. Specific option 'UseUnicode' for SQLite is set to True to avoid broken chars that are not from current locale
    3. Do not set specific option 'UseUnicode' for FPC because UniDAC returns all strings in UTF8 encoding for FPC (to avoid convertation UTF8 -> UTF16 -> UTF8)
    4. Calling the Prepare method is added for TUniQuery that improves performance
    5. Fix metadata returning for Oracle provider

Author: Dmitro25 <d.v.k@mail.ru>
Date:   2020-07-24 12:16:32 +0600

    Corrected dialog width when using custom width
    
    When using "TaskDialogIndirect" function, "Config.cxWidth" parameter should be measured in dialog units (see https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/api/commctrl/ns-commctrl-taskdialogconfig), but "aWidth" is in pixels (according to "Execute" function description). Therefore, we need to either correct the function description (say that "aWidth" is measured in dialog units), or the code.

    Extended UrlEncodeJsonObject to allow exclusion of query delimiter ('?')
    
    When encoding a JSON object for POST-SendData, the query delimiter ('?') must not be present. To allow for that circumstance, an optional parameter IncludeQueryDelimiter (defaulting to previous implementation) has been introduced.

    Introduce THttpServerGeneric.OnAfterResponse
    
    There is no way to get HTTP response code: neither DoAfterRequest or
    DoAfterResponse. This comit add missed OnAfterResponse public property to
    THttpServerGeneric class and extend it with Code parameter.
    
    Usefull for *-access.log, post response analysis, etc.

commit a455fd3e5d4f4535d57823f77a91b72d7c237511
Author: Andre Heider <a.heider@gmail.com>
Date:   2019-08-14 14:11:53 +0200

    SynGdiPlus: add support for image attributes
    
    This adds the flat ImageAttributes GDI+ functions to TGDIPlus and
    introduces the helper class TImageAttributes to work with image
    attributes (which works like MS's ImageAttributes C++ class).
    
    Finally, TSynPicture gained an overloaded Draw() procedure which
    accepts a TImageAttributes argument. TGDIPlusFull gained an overloaded
    DrawAntiAliased() in the same way. Both use DrawImageRectRect() internally,
    so they expose a destination rect as well.

commit ba5c627977a6db20c21e41c7b9b616a5306def63
Author: Bi0T1N <Bi0T1N@users.noreply.github.com>
Date:   2019-05-17 21:12:37 +0200

    Note that sqlite3 var is freed in finalization section
    
    sqlite3 variable is freed automatically in finalization section of the unit,
    if you use sqlite3.Free in the cleanup part (e.g. executed on closing your application)
    you might get an AV because the object is already freed by the finalization code.
    If you only use FreeAndNil to free it, you'll be safe in all cases as it's independent of
    the ordering of unloading the units and therefore execution of finalization code.

    * inherit TSQLMonitorUsage from TSQLRecordNoCaseExtended
    to optimize stored content

    * remove unused parameter in anyBase64toBin
    
    * optimized VariantToBoolean(null)

    * fix unmapping memory mapped files for Unix
    
    * small optimization of TPdfEncryptionRC4MD5.EncodeBuffer
    
    * tuning of TServiceCustomAnswer content SOA logging
    
    * fixed regression after last commit
    
    * several fixes for Delphi 10.3 Rio compatibility
    
    * SyNode: Embadding JavaScript files into executable as a resources
    
    * TCurlHTTP: remove 1 second delay on non-GET requests by disabling sending of 'Expect: 100-continue' HTTP header
    
    * avoid potential AV in curl.slist_append
    
    * fixed potential GPF in latest pull request
    
    * new SynDaemonIntercept function and SynDaemonTerminated flag
    
    * New functions GetProcessInfo to collect more detailed info about Windows processes
    
    * published TDynArrayHashed.ElemPtr/ElemCopyAt methods for Unicode Delphi
    
    * documentation update
    
    * enhanced items per second display during performance tests
    
    * new TSynDaemon.ConsoleMode property
    
    * mast TSynLog constructor as virtual
    
    * TextColor - prevent unnecessary syscalls and made 'thread safe'
    
    * Fixed a bug in TPropInfo.GetVariant handling of tkDynArray. Result from GetOrdProp was being erroneously dereferenced before being passed to TDocVariantData.InitArrayFromObjArray.
    
    * StrLenSSE42 & StcCompSSE42 available only if HASAESIN is defined
    
    * fix access to memory we do not write to in UnCamelCase(D,P)
    
    * add tip about disabling HASAESNI in case testing with valgrind
    
    * add +x permission to SQLite3/build-fpc-linux64.sh and remove #13 in Shebang
    
    * return back call to ioresult to reset a global InOutRes to 0
    
    * add idents (git diff -w can be used to see only valuable changes)
    
    * updated SQLite3 engine to latest version 3.26.0
    
    * fixed TJSONSerializer.RegisterCustomSerializerFieldNames
    - thanks mohsenti for the patch!
    
    * fixed potential GPF in TSQLRestStorage classes when no server is supplied
    (fallback to an owned model instance instead of an hypothetical/ephemeral external server)
    
    * avoid wrongly deleted content with FillZero(RawUTF8/RawByteString)
    
    * fixed TSynAnsiConvert.AnsiBufferToUnicode for FPC/POSIX
    
    * new functions to handle unquoting CSV strings
    
    * Bug fix for broken quoted string (return empty string for such case) and tests.
    
    * Fix Delphi compilation

    * WIP: initial support for Unix Domain Socket

    TSynTempBuffer.Init and TSQLTableJSON will always allocate 16 more bytes than required
    - for a trailing #0 and to ensure our (e.g. TDocVariant) fast JSON parsing won't trigger any GPF (since it may read up to 4 bytes ahead via its PInteger() trick) or any SSE4.2 function applied on the buffer
    - fix for https://github.com/synopse/mORMot/pull/168
    - also fixed other potential buffer overflows (especially in TTextWriter)

    # By Synopse

    * 'master' of https://github.com/synopse/mORMot:
      fixed overloaded constructor TSQLRecord.Create() constructor - thanks hanspi for the patch!
      asynchronous process of 'RemoteLog' client for remote logging to LogView - a dedicated background thread will now run the transmission process without blocking the main program execution, gathering log rows in chunks in case of high activity
      introducing TSQLRest.LogClass property, allowing to set a custom log class for a given TSQLRest instance - this feature impacts also e.g. low-level SQLite3 or MongoDB logging, in the context of our ORM
      TSynLog.Enter won't raise a GPF if the class is nil
      remote logging client-side refactoring   *  CreateForRemoteLogging() constructor is now at TSQLHttpClientGeneric level instead of TSQLHttpClientWinGeneric   *  added TSQLRestClientURI.ServerRemoteLogStart and ServerRemoteLogStop methods
      TSQLHTTPRemoteLogServer class has been moved from LogViewMain.pas into mORMotHttpServer.pas - it will help any application to serve remote log, if needed
      let FindHeader() work if EOL is CRLF or LF only (whereas the HTTP standard states that it should be CRLF on all platforms)
      let remote logging work with SQLite3Log, i.e. with potential nested log events within the echoing callback
      introducing new "Server Launch" button to the LogView tool   *  allows to run the tool as a HTTP server, ready to display remote logs, echoed from mORMot HTTP clients   *  added RemoteLoggingTest client sample project in "11 - Exception logging", able to connect and echo its log content to the LogView tool running as server
      added TSQLHttpServer.Port and DomainName properties
      added TSQLRestClientURI.ServerRemoteLog wrapper to method-based service
      added TSQLRestClientURI.ServerRemoteLog wrapper to method-based service
      handle and log explicitly the most known winhttp.dll error code
      added TMemoryMapText.AddInMemoryLine method to allow runtime appending of new lines of text - used e.g. by TSynLogFile for life update of remote logs - also changed TOnTextWriterEcho callback signature to return a boolean and optionally notify if the echo did succeed
      ensure BatchAdd() will trigger the OnUpdateEvent callback when using the internal SQLite3 engine and its enhanced multi-insert SQL mode - attempt to fix [7a2d9a2ef2]
      fixed samples 18 and 26 which failed to compile due to a signature change of TSQLRecord.InitializeTable() virtual method
      added Delphi XE7 compiler to continuous integration batch
      fixed FPC compilation issues
      cross-platform code refactoring since SmartMobileStudio 2.1.1.3435 did fix some compiler bugs or limitations we identified and reported to the SMS team (thanks for your reactivity, especially Eric!), so that our temporary workarounds are not necessary any more
      official XE7 support of the framework <a href=http://synopse.info/forum/viewtopic.php?id=1990>as reported by users in our forum thread</a>!

      *  it is the first unit of Cross-Platform mORMot clients, running with FPC or Delphi NextGen compilers
      *  it is able to create schema-less objects or arrays, serialize and unserialize them as JSON, via a custom variant type, including late-binding to access the properties (just like our TDocVariant, but cross-platform)

      *  code is simple to follow and should be easy to maintain
      *  we will add a ORM/Table specific class to this unit later
